TopicTitle: KSP Challenge: A Very Kerbal Kerismus Challenge!

Articles.Content:
Hello everyone,

Check out the amazing and creative entries of  the last challenge!

This week we have another theme for you: “A Very Kerbal Kerismus Challenge! "

HO HO HO and Merry Kerismus to one and all!   Yes; it’s that time of year again when all the good little Kerbals come together to celebrate not getting all blow-ded up!

Scoring

According to Kerismus tradition, points for this challenge will be assigned randomly based on a secret formula involving rolled dice, imaginary numbers, negative 1/12th, and outright bribery!  In addition to this totally fair and unbiased point system, there are 4 achievement badges that can be earned! You have 3 weeks for this challenge.  Requirements for achieving each badge of honor are as follows:

1. Better to Give Than to EXPLODE!

Jeb, Bob, Bill, and Val have all been very good little kerbals this year and deserve something extra special!  Design a Kerismus Gift for one of these four kerbals that meets all of the following criteria:

  • Given each of their unique skill sets and personalities, create a special gift that you know they will just love!
  • You can only make one gift for one of the Kerbals
  • The gift has to be transferable from one craft to another
  • The gift must use all stock parts

To earn the achievement badge:

  • Post a picture of your gift (remember you can only submit one)
  • Tell us which Kerbal your gift is for and why they will love it!
  • Optional:  Remember, “T’is better to give, than…”  So, provide a link and share your gift with others participating in the challenge

 

2.   O’ Minmus Tree, O’ Minmus Tree

How min-ty are your bran-ches!   Ahhh yes… The lighting of the Minmus Tree!!  Nothing rings in the holidays quite like the sights and sounds of a giant tree-shaped rocket blasting into space!  Kickoff the holiday season by designing a Minmus Tree that meets all of the following criteria:

  • It should look like… um…  a tree?
  • It should have a place on top for an “ornament” to be attached
  • Do not attach the ornament!
  • Some lights might be good?
  • Any part mods are allowed and encouraged!

To earn the achievement badge, post 4 pictures:

  • The night launch of your Minmus Tree from the KSC
  • While in orbit (somewhere) deliver and attach the ornament
  • Land your Tree on Minmus
  • Hold a Minmus Tree lighting ceremony

 

3. Wee Three Kings

Dis-oriented are… Bearing gifts, we traverse afar…  Indeed at least three wise kings and queens have posted some strange and wondrous gifts!   We can’t let 3 of our most favorite-est kerbals go without gifts now can we?

  • You made one gift for one kerbal now go shop for the rest of em!
  • Find a gift that someone else made for your kerbals that do not have gifts
  • The gift has to be one that was designed specifically for your kerbal and noted somewhere on this challenge thread
  • Starting at the KSC transport the gifts aboard a magnificent sleigh (or rocket) and place them under or near your Minmus Tree
  • Any part mods are allowed and encouraged!
  • Document your adventures as you see fit but include at least one pic of all the wonderful gifts under your Minmus Tree

4. A Kerismus Miracle!

T’was the night before Kerismus, and just before launch…  Not a creature was stirring, and so… nothing had exploded yet!  Kerismus Eve is a special time.  It’s also a pretty special place.  Let’s not forget about our poor little stranded friend: Kringle Kerman

Earn the “Kerismus Eve” achievement by:

  • Spreading a little holiday joy with a trip to Eve
  • Bring along a gift that you acquired or created and deliver it safely (undamaged) to the surface to put a smile on Kringle’s face

…and the achievement would qualify as a true “Kerismus Miracle!” if:

  • Your gift and/or associated stock lander that you made was able to get poor little Kringle back into orbit!

 

Special thanks to @XLjedi for sharing this awesome idea! We will be sharing the badges as we have them ready  

Share your screenshots, videos or images. We want you to have fun and share it with the whole community!

Mission Flag   (Free gift to all who participate!)

Gift_Flag_256x160.png  (10 bonus points if spotted in your pics)

Sample Badges

 

Naughty or Nice?

And of course, there's also one very special badge for "self-proclamations" and/or "proof of" naughty-ness!

Giftshop (usable stock gifts)

Jeb (pilot) Bob (sci) Bill (eng) Val (pilot) Kringle

Space Sleigh

Super-Fast Space Ride

RCS Space Bike

Jeb's Cabin

SkyLark

Mobile Sci-Base

Rejoice Billboard

RC Car

Boombox (mods)

Toy Landing Module Angel Ornament

Badges Earned!
